website_summaries.verdict: Although it lives up to the 4K promise for an affordable price, the BenQ HT2550 lacks the overall performance to beat the competition -- at both 4K and 1080p.
pros: The BenQ HT2550 is one of the least expensive 4K projectors available
It actually produces full 4K resolution onscreen, and its image is slightly sharper than you get from non-4K projectors
cons: The sharpness benefits of 4K are minor, even on a huge screen
Worse contrast than some competing projectors, and poor HDR image quality

customer_reviews.title: I may never leave my movie room!
customer_reviews.text: Wow. I love this thing. It's amazing! I was saving up for the UHD60, but I didn't like that I'd have to give up my love for 3D for it. 3D is only 1080, but I'll take it. Tested Netflix 4k, YouTube 4k (from the Nvidia Shield) and movies from the Samsung UHD player and all were spectacular. Only downside is there is a small light border that extrudes a bit (depending on size of image), and a tiny bit of light that comes from the fan vent, but that is it. I'm loving the RGBRGB color wheel too! Get this thing, you won't be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Toblerone

customer_reviews.title: upgraded from my 2050 and simply amazed.
customer_reviews.text: wow. Almost didn't buy this after reading a few semi-negitve reviews on a projector site. took a chance and so far am completely amazed at this projector. My 2050 was a great projector but I am so glad I took the leap to the 4k model. Have it hooked up to my xbox one x and can completely tell the difference between my old projector and this one. Handles games and movies just fine. there is border light shadow hanging over the side of my edgeless projector screen but doesnt seem to bother me like some others. set-up was simple, I actually tried a reviewers set points and was happy enough to just leave it with those.
customer_reviews.author: C. Ruehlen

customer_reviews.title: Sweet 4K and HDR
customer_reviews.text: Great projector at a reasonable price! 4k/hdr content via the xb1x is jaw dropping gorgeous on this thing. I upgraded to the BenQ from an Optoma HD142x and was surprised on how much bigger the BenQ unit is. Install/Configuration went smoothly and was pretty straight forward. The only hurdles i have run into so far is getting the projector to recognize 3d content via my xb1x/plex setup that was working flawlessly on the Optoma. There doesn't seem to be a way to force it to run either sbs/tab modes like i was able to do on the Optoma. Overall i am very pleased with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: n8

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: While this isn't a native 4K projector, it still looks really good and better than any regular 1080p projector I've seen; especially for the price. It took me a while to get the colors looking good but after I did it looked very good. I was planning on getting the UHD60 but I'm glad I went with this one instead. My only complaint would be the border light which is a dim black light that extends about 6 inches around each edge of my 120 inch screen. After a while I got used to it and didn't even realize it was there anymore. It would be nice if there was some way to get rid of it.
customer_reviews.author: Rodney Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Overall very happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.text: Great picture out of the box, especially at this price point. Really enjoying the upgrade from my prior BenQ 1080p. I though the light border would be annoying, but I made sure to adjust the screen size so that the picture fills the screen. Don't notice the border while watching content. Downside is buzzing sound, but not a deal breaker as usually my surround sound overtakes it and I don't usually sit right underneath it. Would like lens shift option though to make installation a bit easier. Overall very happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: A. DeFoe

customer_reviews.title: Just Buy  It.
customer_reviews.text: Just buy it, it is selling like hot cake and out of stock most of the time. Benq HT2550 will give you amazing color wither it is 1080p or 4K material (4K details is simply awesome). You can watch your 3D movies, even though such feature is not available on most of 4K projectors. Project it on high gain grey screen and you will watch all your movies collection again. Make sure your end to end is UHD HDR10 comparable to make the most out of this projector. Even if you do not have such set up now it is a good buy.
customer_reviews.author: F. Janahi

customer_reviews.title: Excellent 4k projector for home
customer_reviews.text: I am using it with a 110 inch screen in basement multimedia room. I calibrated it using settings found on projectorreviews website and the picture quality is superb. There is enough light output you can easily go with a much bigger screen. I also compared it with a calibrated 75 inch 4K TV. Projector's color is at least on par and probably even better than the TV. There is no loss of clarity even at much bigger size. If you always wanted a theater setup but turned down by price of quality projectors, this one is the right choice.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Horrible, too many malfunctions, not good enough picture above 1080p to be worth it.
customer_reviews.text: I pre-ordered this in advance so I got one of the first that came out and I must say that I wholly regret making this purchase. This is by far the worst projector I’ve ever owned. The picture quality is 4K? Really it’s not much better than 1080p. The projector often fails to boot forcing me to shut down and try again at least 1 out of 10 attempts. I have to pull the power plug out at least once a month to get it to turn on. The keystone capabilities are a joke and there is no lens shift. This budget projector is not with the budget price.
customer_reviews.author: Art Bowman

customer_reviews.title: Wow.
customer_reviews.text: For this price, you get an absolutely stunning picture. Haven't had a problem with the fans yet, it's about as quiet as a ps4, you'll notice it if you focus on it but it really isn't that much of an issue. I ordered a sound bar to give the sound more 'oomf' but if your budget can't handle a high end sound system then the sound from the projector easily does the job. My first projector ever and I'm blown away how close the quality is to my UHD 65" LG OLED tv. You won't get perfect blacks like on a TV but unless you're a diehard for picture quality it really doesn't matter.
customer_reviews.author: This is me

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely briliant projector - blows my Epson 1080p away even with 1080p content.
customer_reviews.text: Just upgraded from an older Epson 1080p projector and WOW - this projector looks amazing. Even my 1080p content looks dramatically improved. It's almost on par with our LG OLED screen with non-HDR content. The HDR performance, however seems to be lacking. Tthe first one I ordered only worked for 20mins and triggered a bulb error. I returned through Amazon and bought a new one - no problems after ~80hrs of use.
customer_reviews.author: D. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Fuzzy focus at edges of frame, no vertical or horizontal slide.
customer_reviews.text: This could be a great projector if your screen and projector are at the exact heights and distances and all your walls are square to each other. There is not the ability to slide the projected frame horizontally or vertically without having the image keystone. The keystone adjust does not bring the image back to square. There is also a large grey light area around the projected frame so the glow around the image was wider than the felt frame on my screen (very distracting). On top of all this if you got the focus right for the center of the image the edges were fuzzy and if the focus was on for the edges the center went fuzzy.
customer_reviews.author: McKell Christensen

customer_reviews.title: Get the HT3550
customer_reviews.text: Out of the box the DLP chip was defective. Sent back to Benq who replaced the chip and sent it back... shipping to repair to returned to me took about two weeks. I was told by Benq that there was an entire batch of these sold through Amazon over Black Friday that had defective DLP chips... so I’m not the only one. No lens shift is an issue. Blacks nowhere near dark enough. It is pretty noisy and gets awfully hot. I’d love to return it and try the HT3550 instead...
customer_reviews.author: BJK

customer_reviews.title: Worst purchase. oh god...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this at Black Friday. However, the power was not turned on. I wanted to exchange for a new product, but it was impossible. I spent $ 109 or shipping to return this in Korea. Nevertheless, I could not get any compensation anywhere. It was the worst purchase in my life. Please refer to those who want to buy in other countries.
customer_reviews.author: ascascasd

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant, super clear picture
customer_reviews.text: I've been enjoying the projector immensely. Brilliant, super clear picture, colors are amazing. Much better than my old projector, an Optoma HD28DSE. My only aggravation is that is slow to start. Minor I know. I recommend this projector to anyone wanting one of the new "enhanced" 4K projectors. I won't get into details, but do your research and compare how BenQ does 4K compared to the way other manufacturers do it.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Beemon

customer_reviews.title: Not bad for a price.
customer_reviews.text: Work straight out of box. Yes, picture quality visually better than my others 3 BENQs. What I don't like is--everything is manual, the lens couldn't give me same magnification as my older projectors. Doing sharpness tinkering manually looks like out of 18th century. And I use white wall around 15 feet diagonally for screen. My setup include Sony receiver as mixer, two regions free players, computer and bunch of USBs.
customer_reviews.author: Alexferdman

customer_reviews.title: Good value and picture quality
customer_reviews.text: Overall, I am satisfied with the purchase, however I wish was quieter. The high noise level is inherent in 4k projectors but I find it very distracting when watching movies and other programs. My quest now is to find a "silencer" for my projector without negatively impacting its performance. I welcome and appreciate any suggestions on how to reduce the noise.
customer_reviews.author: zanahue

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Quality for a reasonable price!
customer_reviews.text: I really liked the image quality. In HDR mode, the images are crisp and rich in color. The product it self is very well built and looks like a quality product. Sound quality from the projector is not so bad. I would definitely recommend this product for a budget 4k projector for the home theater.
customer_reviews.author: KINGTHOTA

customer_reviews.title: GREAT Price
customer_reviews.text: Easy installation, works great in my basement. I would purchase this again. The picture quality is awesome as well. Overall Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Chad

customer_reviews.title: Would Definitely Recommend!
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to set up and use. Amazing picture quality! Cant beat it for the price!
customer_reviews.author: B

customer_reviews.title: This over my oled
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful image! I have two 4k hdr Roku TV's and an LG b7 oled. This projector is my favorite to watch movies and play video games on.
customer_reviews.author: Evander

customer_reviews.title: Amazing projector and worth every penny!!!
customer_reviews.text: We recently set up our media room and instead of buying a bigger tv went the projector route. Watching the World Cup matches in 4k makes you feel as if you're right on the pitch. Movies are amazing and as some other reviews have pointed out, you really don't NEED a sound system but is a definite nice to have to pair with the projector.
customer_reviews.author: Aurel White

customer_reviews.title: Quality picture and great value for money
customer_reviews.text: Overprojection around the edges is a little bothering at times.
customer_reviews.author: OHCustomer

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny.
customer_reviews.text: This BenQ model was worth its price tag. I enjoy watching my Saints, other major sporting events and movies. My son's prefer playing the video game thru this projector whenever they can over the television.
customer_reviews.author: Freddie

customer_reviews.title: Great value and picture quality
customer_reviews.text: I normally don’t write reviews, but this projector is a great value for the price. The 4K picture quality is very good. Although the black levels could be better, the color accuracy is amazing. Plus it is 3D capable, which is rare for 4K projectors. There aren’t that many units that can compete picture/feature wise at this price point.
customer_reviews.author: LT Chu

customer_reviews.title: Defective doesn’t work
customer_reviews.text: This product was defective when it was shipped to me.
customer_reviews.author: NI NOCH

customer_reviews.title: Good 4K Projector
customer_reviews.text: Great overall projector just was a little to dark for me which is why i switched out for the BenQ TK800. I have it showing on 135" Elite Screen. I also see a lot of complain about the fan noise and light border but it is very minimal for me.
customer_reviews.author: Crane

customer_reviews.title: Bad Projector
customer_reviews.text: As beautiful as this projector, it’s came with some vertical white lines. This is my first time of buying BenQ and I think I regret it. I bought it for a project and now I have to return it
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works perfect. A lot of people are just too picky I think.
customer_reviews.author: James Wisniewski

customer_reviews.title: Great 4k picture /3D
customer_reviews.text: Great Projector the 4k HDR is top Notch . The picture Quailty is Clear as they come . The 3D is lots of fun . I love what Benq has done with the quality of this Projector. I would recommend this Projector to anyone over a TV at this size .
customer_reviews.author: Kevin M. Dujnic

customer_reviews.title: You’ll love it!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome projector! The HT2550’s color accuracy and 4k/hdr along with 3D capability is outstanding, killer 3D quality, very clear. A lot of bang for the buck. Highly suggest this project. Just WOW!! Thank you BenQ
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Wellins

customer_reviews.title: Great projector
customer_reviews.text: The projector is really good. Beware of light bleeding around the 120 inch screen. As long as you have black border around your screen, you don't notice the white light. Picture quality is great. HDR needs improvement.
customer_reviews.author: ksoni1506

customer_reviews.title: what happend this projector :((
customer_reviews.text: I bought 5th december at 2018 , I have used 1.5 years, it was good and perfect but I'm experience issue now , what's reason vertical line?
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Game changer
customer_reviews.text: Love this projector just started having movie nights at the church and this was a great addition
customer_reviews.author: marquis johnson

customer_reviews.title: Good price and excellent picture
customer_reviews.text: Good price and excellent picture, however the light border around the picture is distracting. Also no vertical lens shift.
customer_reviews.author: Dima

customer_reviews.title: Awesome 4K projector... definite value for money!!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome projector! Great value for money. Very clear picture, easy to use and pretty quite.
customer_reviews.author: SG

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: We bought this projector for our home theater, worth the money. The price is more reasonable than other 4K projectors as well. Overall, a very great product.
customer_reviews.author: Beena Kalathoor

customer_reviews.title: Very good projector.
customer_reviews.text: Allow to get a high resolution projection for low price.
customer_reviews.author: Lev Furmansky

customer_reviews.title: Great Projector at a great price
customer_reviews.text: The projector exceeded my expectations - Great picture quality at a great price!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the upgrade from 1080p!
customer_reviews.text: Wow! Well worth the upgrade from 1080p to 4K! Summary: - Great price! - Fantastic image quality and color accuracy (especially in HDR) - Bright enough for my room with some ambient light - 3D capability (have yet to test)
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Could have been better. Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: This is my second BenQ HT2550 projector. I had to return the first one due to annoying humming noise/sound which kills the silent scene, 2"-3" inch light border around the screen, 3D not working and light on top of the projector. The replacement has same issues and the firmware is still old firmware 1.0.0 even though I got it on March 14th. Picture quality is good but it goes blank in between. Not sure if it is projector or AVR issue. I am thinking of returning this one too.
customer_reviews.author: Vtdc

customer_reviews.title: Probably best to wait until the summer for them to get ...
customer_reviews.text: Contrary to what is mentioned in the product description: "All units purchased after 3/16/2018 include Firmware Update 1.0.3", I bought one on 3/30/18 and it just arrived with the 1.0.0 firmware. According to the label, this was shipped out on 3/23 from BenQ, so they're still shipping out broken units from the factory. Was upset enough that nobody even tested the 3D, the first time I had to return this. This is just insult to injury. It's a shame, I really wanted this projector. Probably best to wait until the summer for them to get their act together. Or pay a little extra for one of the alternatives.
customer_reviews.author: TechChris

customer_reviews.title: Horrible lag when changing sources
customer_reviews.text: I had to return this product because of the unusual lag that occurs when changes sources. I contacted BenQ and they said it was normal to have a 20 second delay when changing from PS4 to kodi or when adjusting HDR settings. I went with the ViewSonic PX727 and the source lag is only 5-10 seconds. I'm not sure if my unit was defective but source change lag was a deal breaker for me. The picture is decent but I think the PX727 has better contrast and better color
customer_reviews.author: R Brown

customer_reviews.title: Great projector
customer_reviews.text: Great projector... great color and I am able to play my consoles at 120
customer_reviews.author: cj Sorrells

customer_reviews.title: I was quickly disappointed. Not only does the projector black extend much ...
customer_reviews.text: Honestly, I was really excited for this to show up. Sadly, I was quickly disappointed. Not only does the projector black extend much further than expected, the projector makes a horrific buzzing sound. It didn’t last 15 minutes on my ceiling. The only reason it got 2 stars is that the image quality was superb, if you can get over the other issues. As for me, back to my trusty 1080p projector I go for now.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Dalhover

customer_reviews.title: Great picture, but defective from the box.
customer_reviews.text: The picture quality is truly amazing, a little upset about the light on top, but it’s ok for that price. But the most sadness part is that the projector is defective right from the box (half image with crossed vertical lines in white)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Red light of death.  Won’t turn on
customer_reviews.text: Initially turned on for and showed a picture for about 30 seconds. Then, went to standby (orange power light). When power button is pressed, power light flashes green twice, then goes to steady red for about 15 seconds, then back to orange. Will not turn on. Manual says this is a scaler reset failure. Amazon is sending me a new one with free one day shipping. We shall see. I’ve seen others write about this issue.
customer_reviews.author: James C.

customer_reviews.title: Super disappointed! got this today
customer_reviews.text: Super disappointed! got this today, do a simple setup and see how it goes. focus is super super bad! no matter how I adjust, its just blurry especially with text. portion of screen just blurry......... will play 4K movie see how HDR perform. but so far, it's going back to Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: CDW

customer_reviews.title: What a bummer!
customer_reviews.text: After waiting out the 2 week shipping delay the 2550 finally showed up today. I was so excited. Took the old projector down. Mounted the new one. Plugged everything in. Power on. Nothing. The green led light flashed, went out and the red off light came on, then all the lights went off. There ya go. Nothing. A flop. I haven’t called Benq support yet, actually I did but they closed 4 minutes before I called, but I will contact them in the morning. Hopefully it’s just a bad lamp, which is still pretty crappy, but that’s an easy fix. If that’s the problem. I was really excited. Was.
customer_reviews.author: John M. Rodriguez

product_meta.title: BenQ HT2550 4K UHD HDR Home Theater Projector, 8.3 Million Pixels, 2200 Lumens, Rec.709, Audiovisual Enhancer, 3D, HDMI
product_meta.description:
Display
Projection System: DLP
Native Resolution: 3840x2160 (XPR pixel shifting technology)
Resolution Support: VGA (640 x 480) to 4K UHD (3840 x 2160)
Brightness (ANSI lumens): 2200 ANSI Lumens‎
Contrast Ratio (FOFO): 10,000:1 ‎
Display Color: 30 Bits (1.07 billion color)
Native Aspect Ratio: Native 16:9 (6 aspect ratio selectable)
Light Source: Lamp
Light Source Wattage: 240W‎
Light Source Life:
Normal 4000 hours
Economic 10000 hours
SmartEco 8000 hours
LampSave 15000 hours

Optical
Throw Ratio: 1.47 - 1.76 (100" @ 3.25 m)
Zoom Ratio: 1.2X
Lens: F/# = 1.94 - 2.06, f = 15.57 - 18.67 mm
Keystone Adjustment: 1D, Vertical ± 40 degrees 
Projection Offset: 110%
Clear Image Size (Diagonal): 60" ~ 200" 
Image Size: 30''~300''
Horizontal Frequency: 15K - 102KHz‎
Vertical Scan Rate: 23 - 120Hz‎

Picture
Picture Mode:
* ISF Disabled: Bright / Vivid / Cinema/ Sport/ User 1/ User 2
** ISF Enabled: Bright / Vivid / Cinema/ Sport/ User 1/ User 2/ ISF Night/ ISF Day
Color Wheel Segment: 6-Seg. (RGBRGB)
Rec.709 Coverage: >96%

Audio
Speaker: 5W x 1

Interface
PC (D-Sub): x 1
HDMI: 2 (HDMI 1: 2.0 / HDCP 2.2; HDMI 2: 1.4a / HDCP 1.4)
USB Type A: 1(2.0/Power Supply)
USB (Type mini B): x 1
Audio in (3.5mm Mini Jack): x 1
Audio out (3.5mm Mini Jack): x 1
RS232 (DB-9pin): x 1
DC 12V Trigger (3.5mm Jack): x 1
IR Receiver: 2(Front/Top)
Security Bar: 1

Special Feature
HDR: Yes
ISF Night/Day: Yes

Compatibility
HDTV Compatibility: 480i, 480p, 576i, 576p, 720p, 1080i, 1080p, 2160p
3D Compatibility‎:
Frame Sequential: Up to 1280x720 120Hz
Frame Packing: Up to 1080p 24Hz
Top Bottom: Up to 720p 60Hz

Environment
Power Supply: VAC 100 ~ 240 (50/60Hz)
Typical Power Consumption: 330W
Standby Power Consumption: 0.5W
Acoustic Noise (Typ./Eco.) : 33/29dB 
Operating Temperature: 0~40℃

Dimension and Weight
Dimensions (W x H x D)(in) :13.9 x 5.3 x 10.7 in
Net Weight (lbs): 9.2 lbs

Accessories Included (Standard)
Carton: Color carton
Remote Control w/ Battery: x 1 (RCV015)
Power Cord (by region): x 1 (3m)
User Manual CD: x 1 (27L)
Quick Start Guide: x1 (21L)
Warranty Card (by region): x 1
Lens cover: x 1
feature_bullets: True 4K UHD Resolution: 8.3 million distinct pixels deliver awe-inspiring 4K UHD image quality with stunning clarity and crisply defined details
Projector-optimized HDR: supercharged by HDR10 support with BenQ exclusive Auto HDR color rendition and cinema-optimized technology
Cinematic Color technology accurately reproduces >96% of Rec.709 color gamut for authentic cinema experiences
Smallest & lightest 4K HDR Projector: light, sleek, compact design with Auto vertical Keystone and 1.2x zoom make installation quick and easy
All units purchased after 3/16/2018 include Firmware Update 1.0.3

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.8 out of 5 stars124 ratings3.8 out of 5 stars
